title: Pixie Lott looks stylish in a navy dungaree dress as she attends art event with Oliver Cheshire
text:
They're set to marry next year after getting engaged in 2016.

And Pixie Lott and fiancé Oliver Cheshire looked every inch the happy couple as they attended an art show in Dusseldorf, Germany, on Thursday night.

The singer, 28, cut a fashionable figure in a blue dungaree dress with red stitching and her model partner, 31, looked incredibly dapper in a striped suit.

Couple: Pixie Lott, 28, looked sensational in a blue dungaree style dress as she attended an art event in Dusseldorf, Germany, with her smart fiancé Oliver Cheshire on Thursday night

Pixie looked sensational in her sleeveless dark blue dress which crossed at the front and featured two buckles.

The Cry Me Out songstress also toted a small leather handbag with a metal top handle which featured a gold star on it for the evening out.

She completed her look by donning a pair of black heels and tying her blonde locks back in a chic up do.

Chic: The singer showed off her toned legs in the blue mini dress and added some height to her frame with black heels

Happy: Model Oliver paired his suit with brown shoes and a light blue shirt for the art event

Pixie also added a touch of red lipstick, which complemented the red stitching in her unusual dress.

Model Oliver looked equally stylish and donned a grey striped suit as the engaged couple enjoyed a private view of Extremis by Sassan Behnam-Bakhtiar.

He wore a pair of smart brown leather boots and a light blue shirt to complete his look, which was left unbuttoned at the top.

During the event Pixie and Oliver also met the artist, Sassan Behnam-Bakhtiar, who looked chic in a navy blazer and t-shirt.

All together: The couple, left, got to meet the artist Sassan Behnam-Bakhtiar, second right, during the evening and Zafar Rushdie, right

Glam: Pixie styled her blonde locks in a chic up do and added bright red lipstick to her look

Dapper: The men opted for smart suits during the private view of Sassan's artwork, Extremis

Only recently, Pixie revealed to MailOnline that she plans to try and squeeze in six hen dos as she talked wedding plans and trying to make it in America following her first public performance stateside.

The Cry My Heart Out hitmaker, who previously noted that she has 18 bridesmaids following her down the aisle, also admitted that it has been a bit 'hectic' trying to plan her wedding to her model fiancé.

Speaking at a pop-up Coca-Cola photo booth in London's Covent Garden, Pixie gave insights into her upcoming wedding and revealed how she first asked her pals and family to be apart of her big day.

Style: Pixie toted a small black bag with a metal top handle which was adorned with a gold star

Future: Pixie is currently planning her wedding to Oliver and previously revealed she will have 18 bridesmaids follow her down the aisle in 2020

In good company: Lilah Parsons, Pixie and Hannah Phillips attended the do

Candlelit dinner: They sat for food with [pictured with Rosie Tapner and Zafar Rushdie]

Dinner for two? Pixie sat alongside Ali Behnam-Bakhtia

She said: 'We did a whole shebang and I made little parcels, which is how they all found out, but we’ve done one hen do so far but I did say we were going to have six, so I need to try and fit that in before the wedding.'

Pixie's 'lovely' entourage will include her best friends from school, cousins and family friends, who she said she is desperate to find the perfect dress for.

Detailing her stress over finding the right gown, she said: 'I just want to make sure I get a dress that they’re all happy with because they’re all different shapes and sizes and I want them to all wear the same thing - apart from the little flower girls.'

A vision in white: Jodie Kidd looked radiant at the event as she slipped into a cream shirt style dress with a chunky black belt that cinched in at her tiny waist
description: Pixie Lott, 28, cut a fashionable figure in a blue dungaree dress with red stitching as she went to a private art viewing with her fiancé Oliver Cheshire in Dusseldorf, Germany, on Thursday.
